downloadTitle: How to Configure Envelope Journaling on Microsoft Exchange Server 2007 for Exchange Hosted Services
downloadDescription: This document describes how to configure envelope journaling on Microsoft Exchange Server 2007 to work with Exchange Hosted Services.
detailsSection:
Envelope journaling is an Exchange Server feature that lets a company separate the messages being archived. It can also identify blind carbon copy (Bcc) recipients and distribution list recipients for any e-mail message.
This document provides the necessary steps for a Microsoft® Exchange Server administrator to properly configure envelope journaling on Exchange Server 2007 to work with the Exchange Hosted Services (EHS) Hosted Archive or Hosted Continuity service.
systemRequirementsSection: • The file is a Microsoft Word document. Users who do not have Microsoft Word can view this document through the downloadable Word Viewer.
installInstructionSection:
1. Click the Download button on this page to start the download, or choose a different language from the drop-down list and click Go.
  2. Do one of the following:
    • To start the installation immediately, click Open or Run this program from its current location.
    • To copy the download to your computer for installation at a later time, click Save or Save this program to disk.
